H0.text: In most fungi, the haploid nuclei contributed by each parent do not fuse right away.

H1.text: Filter is what the haploid nuclei contributed by each parent do not do right away in most fungi.

H2.text: Disperse is the action that the haploid nuclei contributed by each parent do not do right away in most fungi.

H3.text: Vaporize is the action that the haploid nuclei contributed by each parent do not do right away in most fungi.

A4.text: These nuclei do not immediately fuse, and remain haploid in a n+n state until the very onset of meiosis

A5.text: Heterokaryosis is most common in fungi, but also occurs in slime molds
